messages.message:
Context:
Environment: UAT 24.38
Topic: Running Build app Deployments

When running deployments using the `drag & drop` method (specifically, dropping in a folder - screenshot_2), the deployment is automatically kicked off:
• files are uploaded
• files start to get processed
• app runs
• results sent downstream
I didn't notice any option to abort the process, which could be costly from both a time & units perspective. Might it be helpful to include a confirmation step before running the deployment "manually"?

Screenshots in order show:
• SS1: Viewing the file picker UI pop-up after clicking `run deployment` in the upper right corner of the `Deployments -> Runs` page
• SS2: Selecting a folder
• Not shown: dropping the folder into the drag & drop area
• SS3: Run being initiated
• SS4: Run completed

*Assigning human reviewers: Workspace roles that can be assigned as reviewers*

*Context:*
Environment: UAT 24.38
Topic: Running Build app Deployments

*Subject description:*
*Screenshot 1* shows the UI when looking at deployment runs. Additionally, it shows a `Group` that's part of the workspace ("Automation Group 1") which is a `Member` role in the workspace (ie not a `Manager` nor `Admin`).

*Screenshot 2* shows hovering over the `Reviewer` assigned to the first document/run record in the table. Specifically, it shows the ability to assign a review. I'll click into this for the next screenshot.

*Screenshot 3* shows the reviewer picker/assigner pop-up.

*Screenshot 4* shows selectable reviewers.

*Screenshots 5 & 6* show I can't assign `Managers` nor `Admins` as reviewers
• I can only choose `members` as reviewers, but not `Managers` nor `Admins`
• I can understand why review tasks are assigned to `members` only by default, but I feel like it might be helpful to allow end-users to opt-in to being able to assign other roles as reviewers (maybe there can be controls/permissions around this.) 
:fast_forward:  *TL;DR:*
It may be helpful to be able to assign `Managers` and `Admins` as human reviewers instead of just `Members`.

:memo: _*Side note:* Oops, I meant to send this as a separate message, but alas, added it to this thread as a reply_ :lil_nervous:

RE: Assigning human reviewers: (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C0516UPPMT3/p1727387094985509?thread_ts=1727385963.465399&cid=C0516UPPMT3)

After further testing, it seems like if you are part of a group at all that is a `Member` in a workspace, you are able to be assigned as a reviewer *regardless of if you are a `Admin` or `Manager`* 
(Note: `Admins` & `Managers` added to a `Member` level group are do not lose their elevated roles)

Hey @Brian ! The behavior you're seeing for review reassignment doesn't have to do with being a part of a group or your role - it's because of the _specific_ group that those users you see listed are a part of. That document is in a review queue, so you can only select members of the group that are assigned to that review queue. Maybe we could add some copy about where those options for assignees are coming from? i.e., "showing eligible review queue group members"

For the file upload behavior - looks like the analogous behavior for running apps might have changed since I implemented this! I'll make a ticket to make it show that you've uploaded a file before it starts processing.

If you hover over the row that's in progress, you should see a cancel button
